page.title: 14The Post Office
page.content: Sale General Post Office has a very busy sorting office which opens from 5.15am until 12.57pm. Our guides explained that boxes with red labels are for first class letters and boxes with green labels are for second class letters. First class are franked in a machine with the time and date but second class only with the date. About 3000 letters a day pass through the machine. They are sorted into "pigeon holes". A postman's round is called a walk and a van's route a track. There are fifty eight walks in Sale. Twenty six thousand houses are delivered to. There are fifty eight pilar boxes. About two thousand businesses receive letters. One hundred and fifty pounds is taken weekly from 'phone boxes and the coins are counted and separated in a machine in the Post Office.
